document.masterDocTitle: An annotated checklist of the Coccinellidae (Coleoptera) from New Caledonia

subSubSection.paragraph:
This American species has been introduced (from a Tahitian strain) to New Caledonia in 1987 to achieve biological control against
Heteropsylla cubana
( Hemiptera : Psyllidae ), which was destroying
Leucaena leucocephala (Lam.)
de Wit, a legume used as fodder for extensive cattle breeding (
Chazeau 1987
; Chazeau et al. 1991 ;
Disney & Chazeau 1990
). This ladybug is now widespread all over New Caledonia , including Isle of Pines and Walpole Island . There are two color morphs which have been introduced, the paler one is the most widespread in New Caledonia (
Gatimel 2005
). This species is also recorded from North
America
(its native range), Hawaii and French Polynesia . It is known to feed on various prey sources (Chazeau et al. 1991 ): psyllids (e.g.,
Heteropsylla cubana
), aphids [e.g.,
Cerataphis lataniae (Boisduval)
] and cicadellids (e.g., Iassinae larvae).

Material examined.
NEW CALEDONIA
: Bac de la Ouaïème, rive Sud,
